fr-location.header: Where are you making this report?

local-authority-contacted-about-child.header: Which local authority have you contacted about the child?
local-authority-contacted-about-child.paragraph-1: You must contact the relevant local authority to safeguard the child before continuing.
local-authority-contacted-about-child.paragraph-2: If the child is in an Independent Child Trafficking Guardian (ICTG) area you will also need to refer them to the

pv-under-age-at-time-of-exploitation.header: Were they under 18 at any time during the exploitation?

when-did-the-exploitation-take-place.header: When did the exploitation take place?
when-did-the-exploitation-take-place.paragraph: If they know exact start and end dates, ask for a loose time frame (such as a month or year), how old they were, or if it was a recent incident. If multiple incidents, list the dates or timeframe of each.

more-than-one-exploitation-situation.header: Have they been in more than one exploitative situation?
more-than-one-exploitation-situation.paragraph-1: If yes, please make sure that details from all exploitative situations are captured in the following questions.

how-did-the-exploitation-start.paragraph: Explore what promises were made, what they were expecting to do, and what pay was promised.

how-they-were-treated.header: How were they treated during their exploitation?

how-why-did-they-leave-the-situation.header: How and why did they leave the situation?

when-last-contact.header: When were the potential victim and exploiters last in contact?

details-last-contact.header: Last contact between the potential victim and their exploiters
details-last-contact.paragraph-1: To assess the risk that the potential victim may be exploited or trafficked again, we need to know about any communication between them and their exploiters.
details-last-contact.paragraph-2: You can provide information about how they communicated, what was said and who was involved.
details-last-contact.paragraph-3: Include details about any threats the exploiters have made. If applicable, describe any steps the potential victim has taken to prevent contact with their exploiters.

is-this-the-first-chance-to-report.header: Is this the first chance they have had to report this?

why-report-now.header: Why are they reporting this now?

why-are-you-making-the-referral.header: Why are you making the referral?
why-are-you-making-the-referral.paragraph-1: Include relevant evidence or information, such as:
why-are-you-making-the-referral.paragraph-2: The information you enter is disclosable
why-are-you-making-the-referral.bullet-3: an intention to exploit the individual
why-are-you-making-the-referral.bullet-4: circumstances which put the individual at a heightened level of vulnerability

where-how-interview-carried-out.header: Where and how was the interview carried out?

are-others-involved.header: Are there other professionals or organisations involved with this case?

evidence-of-dishonesty.header: Are there indicators or evidence that they could be acting dishonestly?
evidence-of-dishonesty.paragraph-1: Do not include examples of them withholding or changing their information if you think they have done this because they:
evidence-of-dishonesty.bullet-2: are trying to avoid reliving their trauma

what-evidence-you-will-submit.header: What documents or evidence will you submit with this referral?
what-evidence-you-will-submit.paragraph-1: After submitting this referral, you will receive an email with instructions on how to submit documents or evidence about this case.

where-exploitation-happened-uk.header: Where were they exploited in the UK?
where-exploitation-happened-uk.paragraph-1: If the exploitation was in more then one location, add more towns or cities.
where-exploitation-happened-uk.select-overseas-note: Once you press continue you will be able to add more details about the overseas locations.

where-exploitation-happened-overseas.paragraph-1: If the exploitation was in more then one location, add more countries.

types-of-exploitation.warning: If you think they are a victim of another crime you can report it to the police by calling 101.

any-other-pvs.header: Were there any other potential victims?

future-exploitation.header: Are there concerns that the potential victim could be exploited again in the future?

concerns-future-exploitation.header: Why are there concerns about exploitation in the future?

reported-to-police.header: Do they have a crime reference number related to any reported Modern Slavery crime, in which they are a victim?

authorities-cooperation.paragraph-1: The UK public authorities (such as law enforcement agencies) may investigate or undertake criminal proceedings into any incidents you’ve reported in this referral.

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.header: Do they want their case referred to the NRM?

refuse-nrm.header: Why don't they want their case referred?

does-pv-need-support.paragraph-1: Support can take 5 days to start unless the potential victim needs emergency housing.
does-pv-need-support.paragraph-2: Support can take 5 days to start and may include:
does-pv-need-support.bullet-3: someone to help them cope with their experience
does-pv-need-support.bullet-4: protection from the people who exploited them

pv-name-referral.header: What is the name of the Potential Victim?

pv-name-dtn.header: What is the name of the Potential Victim?

pv-dob.header: What is their date of birth? (Optional)

pv-other-help-with-communication.header: Do they need help with communication?

pv-ho-reference.header: Do they have any Home Office references?

who-contact.header: Who should we send our decision to?

pv-phone-number.header: Can the support provider contact them by phone?

fr-details.read-only-field-1-hint: This is the address you gave at the start of the form.
fr-details.read-only-field-2-hint: This is the organisation you gave at the start of the form.

fr-alternative-contact.header: Who should we contact in your absence?  (Optional)

reference.label: Your reference
reference.hint: This will not be included in the report

how-did-the-exploitation-start.label: How they came to be exploited

how-why-did-they-leave-the-situation.label: How and why they left the situation

when-last-contact.label: When were they last in contact with exploiters

is-this-the-first-chance-to-report.label: Is this the first chance they have had to report this?

what-evidence-you-will-submit.label: List of documents or evidence to be submitted

where-exploitation-happened-uk.label: Where were they exploited in the UK?

does-pv-need-support.label: Support requested
does-pv-need-support.automatic-referral: Support can not be requested when potential victims under 18 years old

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.label: Case referred to NRM
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.automatic-referral: Automatic referral when potential victim under 18 years old or age unknown

co-operate-with-police.label: Permission for police to contact them

pv-phone-number.label: Permission for support provider to contact them

fr-details-email.label: Email
fr-details-email.info: The email you are using for this report

confirmation.paragraph-1: You will shortly receive a confirmation email with a reference number. You will also receive a copy of your report for your records.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-1: We will look at the potential victim’s case within 5 working days and decide if there are reasonable grounds to believe they are a victim of modern slavery.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-2: We may contact you if we need more information.
confirmation.heading-1-paragraph-1-dtn: The information provided will be shared with Police and other law enforcement agencies in order to build a better picture of modern slavery in England and Wales. It will also be used to improve our law enforcement response.
confirmation.heading-2: If the potential victim needs support
confirmation.heading-2-paragraph-1: Support can take up to 5 days to start. If they need help immediately, you’ll need to contact the relevant provider or local authority for more information.
confirmation.heading-3-paragraph-4-link-1: What did you think of this service?

reference.header: What’s your reference for this report?

organisation.header: What organisation do you work for?

send-pdf.header: Enter the email to send the Pdf
